docs.title: Welcome to the Management Portal Documentation
Manage and get insights for your account, team, or organization.
docs.text:
Welcome to Qodo's Insight-Agent, designed to:

  • Enhance your interaction with other agents.
  • Gain important insights and metrics on your team's software development.
  • [TBD] Get a clear ROI view of your usage of Qodo's agent suite.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
Go to your management portal at app.qodo.ai

Alternatively, you can access the portal from Qodo Gen: click the three dots at the top-right of the extension, then choose User Portal.

  • VSCode

    Install Qodo Gen extension for VSCode

  • JetBrains

    Install Qodo Gen plugin for all JetBrains IDEs

docs.title: Main capabilities
docs.text:
Qodo Gen's User Portal comes packed with features to enhance every step of your development cycle:

Method Description Manage Account TBD Manage Teams & Roles Upgrade your account to gain access to premium features, Edit account details and payment methods, and view invoices. Manage Organizations & Roles TBD Manage enterprise features. Get Insights Get statistics of usage and tools ROI on the individual, team, and organization levels [Currently available for Enterprise plan only, coming soon to all other plans]. Connect your Qodo Merge Pro Get the best PR review tool by connecting your git provider and Qodo accounts.

docs.title: Join the community
docs.text: If you need assistance or have questions about The Management Portal, feel free to email us at support@qodo.ai or join our Discord community.

docs.title: Developer & Teams' plan members
docs.text: This page describes all the possible functionalities that are available to members of the Developer's & Teams' plans.

docs.title: Organization Administrators
docs.text: This page describes all the possible functionalities available to administrators of organizations in the Enterprise plan.

docs.title: Managing Your Organization in Qodo
docs.text: The 'Organization' section in Qodo allows you to create new teams, manage existing teams, and invite team members. - TBD

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text: This section provides high-level summary metrics that give a quick snapshot of overall performance. It may include metrics such as number of active user, Trigger per day etc.

docs.title: Invite only enterprise
docs.text:
Invite-only members are users who are only considered part of the organization once they receive and accept an invitation.

Users do not automatically become members, but they become exclusively associated with the organization through an invitation process. This approach allows the organization to maintain tighter control over who can join and access its resources.

docs.title: Pending Status
docs.text: After the invitation is sent, these users are marked with an "Access Pending" status until they accept the invitation.

docs.title: Controlled Access
docs.text: Admins can manage who gets invited, allowing for controlled and secure access to the organization's resources. Once an invitation is pending, the admin will receive a notification in the dashboard.

docs.title: Invite Members
docs.text:
1. On the dashboard, locate and click on the "Invite Member" link. The invite member page will be displayed.

  2. Enter the email addresses of the individuals you wish to invite to the Qodo community.

  3. It is also possible to extend an invitation to members from the file. To invite members from a file, simply place the file in the "Drop file here" position.

  4. Click " Invites" to dispatch the invitations.

docs.title: Managing Your Team in Qodo
docs.text: As a team member, you do not have the authority to manage any team. You can only view the team you are part of. However, the admin can grant you administrative rights if needed.

docs.title: Removing Team Members
docs.text: To remove a member from the team, click on the delete icon (trash can) located to the right of the member’s name.

docs.title: Portal as individual
docs.text:
Once you have successfully logged in, you will be directed to the Qodo Dashboard. The dashboard offers the following features:

  • Install Qodo Gen extension in your IDE

  • Connect Qodo Merge to repositories,

  • Invite members to join dIscord community, and

  • Invite team members to join your team.

docs.title: Install Qodo Gen Extension for Supported IDEs
docs.text:
1. On the dashboard, locate the "Extensions" tab or section. A list of supported IDEs (Integrated Development Environments) will be displayed.

  2. Select your preferred IDE from the list (e.g., Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ IDEA, etc.).

  3. Follow the on-screen instructions to download and install the Qodo Gen extension for the selected IDE.

  4. Once installed, the extension will enhance your IDE with Qodo Gen's features.

docs.title: Join Qodo Discord Community
docs.text:
1. On the dashboard, locate and click on the "Join Discord" link. The discord homepage will be displayed.

  2. Enter the Display name and click Continue.

docs.title: Invite Members
docs.text:
1. On the dashboard, locate and click on the "Invite Member" link. The invite member page will be displayed.

  2. Enter the email addresses of the individuals you wish to invite to the Qodo community.

  3. It is also possible to extend an invitation to members from the file. To invite members from a file, simply place the file in the "Drop file here" position.

  4. Click " Invites" to dispatch the invitations.

docs.title: Connect Qodo Merge to Your Repository
docs.text:
1. On the dashboard, locate the "Connect Qodo Merge" tab or section. A list of supported repositories will be displayed.

  2. Choose your repository hosting service (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket). The Qodo Merge window will be displayed.

  3. Click on the "Connect" button. Authenticate and authorize Qodo to connect your repository.

  4. Configure the Qodo Merge (Pull Request) settings as needed. For more information, refer to (https://codium-ai.github.io/docs/pragent/)

docs.title: Step 1: Access the Sign Up page
docs.text: Open your web browser and navigate to the Qodo sign-in page (https://app.qodo.ai/signin)

docs.title: Step 2: Choose Your Sign Up Method
docs.text:
On the sign up page, you will be presented with three options for signing up:

  1. Sign up with Google

  2. Sign up with Github

  3. Sign up with Email

docs.title: Sign up with Google
docs.text:
1. Click on the "Continue with Google" button. You will be redirected to Google's login page.

  1. Choose an account or use your google email and password.

  2. You will be redirected back to the portal with your Google account linked.

docs.title: Sign up with Github
docs.text:
1. Click on the "Continue with GitHub" button. You will be redirected to GitHub's login page.

  2. Enter your GitHub username and password, then click "Sign in".

  3. Authorize the application by clicking "Authorize" if prompted.

  4. You will be redirected back to the portal with your GitHub account linked.

docs.title: Sign up with Email
docs.text:
1. Click on the "Contuine with Email" button. Enter a valid email address. Check your email for a verification link sent by the portal.

  2. Click the verification link to activate your account.

docs.title: Accepting an Invitation to join Qodo
docs.text:
1. Open your email inbox associated with the invitation. Look for an email from Qodo with the subject line "Join your team - enjoy Qodo".

  2. Inside the email, locate and click on the "Accept the Invite" button. This will redirect you to the Qodo login

  3. Enter the same email address that received the invitation.

  4. Click the "Continue with email" button to access your Qodo account. Click the Login button to access your Qodo account.

docs.title: Account Settings
docs.text:
The account settings enable you to edit your account details, as well as other account-related actions such as visiting the documentation section and deleting your account.

To access the account settings, click on the profile icon located the upper right corner of the screen. A dropdown menu will appear providing the following options:

  • Account Name: View and edit your account name.

  • Plan Activate: View details about your current plan.

  • Account Settings: Access and edit detailed account settings.

  • Go to Docs: Visit the documentation section.

  • Sign Out: Sign out of your Qodo account.

docs.title: Team Administrators
docs.text: This page descripbes all the possible functionalities available to administrators of teams in the Teams' and Enterprise plans.

docs.title: Managing Your Team in Qodo
docs.text: The "My Team" or "Teams @ Enterprise name" section in Qodo allows you to create new teams, manage existing teams, and invite team members.

docs.title: Manage Plan
docs.text: In the dropdown menu under "Manage Team," select "Manage Plan" to adjust your team’s subscription or plan details.

docs.title: Upgrading plan
docs.text:
Upgrade your plan to ensure your team has access to the best features and resources Qodo has to offer. Follow the steps below to upgrade your plan.

  1. Click on the "Upgrade Now" button located at the top upper corner of the dashboard.

  2. Review the available plans (Developer, Teams, Enterprise) and select the one that best suits your team’s needs.

  3. Click the "Subscribe" button to start the upgrade process.

docs.title: Invoice History
docs.text:
You can easily access and manage your invoices on the portal.

  1. Click the "Manage Team" button located in the upper right corner of each team.

  2. Select "Manage Plan" to view your team’s subscription or plan details.

  3. Scroll down to the end of the Plan section to view the INVOICE HISTORY section where you can view the status of your invoices (paid or unpaid).

  4. In the INVOICE HISTORY section, find the invoice you wish to view.

  5. Click on the Download Invoice or Download Receipt Receipt button next to the invoice. The invoice will be downloaded as a PDF file.

docs.title: Cancel Subscription
docs.text:
To cancel an existing subscription:

  1. In your team’s subscription or plan details page, Click the Cancel Plan button.

  2. Review the information provided, including any details about the remaining subscription. Confirm your decision by clicking on Cancel Plan button.

  3. You will be asked to provide feedback on why you are cancelling. This step is optional.

  4. Ensure that your subscription status in the Billing section reflects the cancellation.

docs.title: Creating a New Team
docs.text:
To create a new team:

  1. On the Qodo dashboard, select the "My Team" tab, then click on the "Create Team" button.

  2. Enter your desired team name in the provided field.

  3. Click the "Submit" button to create your team.

  4. The new team will be displayed in the board.

docs.title: Managing Your Team
docs.text: The manage team feature allows you to manage existing teams, manage plan, manage SSO and close team. Click the "Manage Team" button located in the upper right corner of each team.

docs.title: Close Team
docs.text:
To disband the team, select "Close Team" from the dropdown menu. Confirm your action if prompted.

Note: Removing your team will remove current team members and terminate the existing subscription.

docs.title: Removing Team Members
docs.text: To remove a member from the team, click on the delete icon (trash can) located to the right of the member’s name.

docs.title: Inviting Team Members
docs.text:
You can add new members to the team by inviting them. To invite an team member:

  1. In the "My Team" section, click on the "Invite Member" button. The invite member page will be displayed.

  2. Enter the email addresses of the individuals you wish to invite to the Qodo community.

  3. It is also possible to extend an invitation to members from a file. To invite members from a file, simply place the file in the "Drop file here" position.

  4. Click "Invites" to dispatch the invitations.
